	You will work for Clyra LLC (USA), an American company, with payment in US dollars (USD).

Fleet / Logistics Officer Job at Geoaudits




        
    

        
        Geoaudits' specialties include fleet and logistics, Driver training, Hiring and outsourcing, business development, property. Use of GPS in fleet management audits and reconciliations.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Fleet / Logistics Officer
Job Location: Amuwo-Odofin, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a responsible and experienced Fleet / Logistics Officer to manage truck operations and coordinate drivers for efficient and safe delivery of goods.


Key Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Supervise and coordinate truck drivers and daily fleet operations.
	Plan routes and schedule truck movements to meet delivery timelines.
	Monitor driver attendance, conduct, and compliance with company policies.
	Ensure trucks are roadworthy, properly licensed, insured, and maintained.
	Track fuel usage, mileage, and vehicle running costs.
	Monitor GPS tracking systems and driver performance.
	Enforce safety standards and compliance with road regulations.
	Prepare daily and monthly fleet/logistics reports.
	Handle breakdowns, incidents, and accident reports.


Requirements


	OND / HND / B.Sc. in Logistics, Transport Management, Business Administration, or related field.
	2–4 years of experience in fleet or logistics operations (truck-focused).
	Proven experience supervising truck drivers.
	Good knowledge of Lagos road networks.
	Basic knowledge of vehicle maintenance.
	Computer literacy (Excel and basic fleet systems).
	Strong leadership, communication, and organizational skills.
	Candidates must reside in or around Amuwo-Odofin / Apapa / Mile 2 axis.

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Software Engineer / Developer",
  "description": "NeoLiving Limited operates at the intersection of real estate and technology, creating intelligent platforms to revolutionize how properties are discovered and secured. With a focus on fast, transparent, and secure property transactions, NeoLiving eliminates risks such as document fraud. Based in Nigeria, the company leverages local market expertise and advanced technology to cater to the evolving needs of African living. NeoLiving strives to build trust into every property interaction through innovative and reliable systems

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Software Engineer / Developer
Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Contract

About the Role


	NeoLiving is PropTech startup that is focused on pure execution.
	We are not looking for a manager to direct others; we are looking for a Builder&mdash;someone ready to execute.
	We need someone ready to leverage modern AI tools to ship real features.
	You will not be managing a backlog or writing documents; you will be building the platform that brings trust to the Nigerian property market.


What You Will Actually Do


	Own Your Stack: You will work with React (TypeScript) and modern backend tools. You will not just follow instructions; you will figure out how to make the database secure, the logic sound, and the application performant.
	Refactor &amp; Ship: You will dive into the existing codebase, clean up the rough edges, optimise the logic, and ship it to production.
	Solve Real Problems: You will build features that real people use to buy and rent homes.
	Learn Speed: You will work directly with the Co-founders. You will learn how to ship features in days, not months.


Who You Are


	You have built something before: You have shipped working digital products in the past. You have a portfolio that proves you can finish what you start.
	You are a Troubleshooter: When you hit an error, you do not wait for a manager to chase you around. You search for the solution, you read the documentation, and you fix it.
	You are Autonomous: You do not wait to be told&nbsp;how&nbsp;to do your job. You understand the goal and you find the best way to achieve it.
	You want to grow: You see this role as a stepping stone to becoming a Senior Engineer or a CTO one day.


Requirements


	Solid Experience: 3+ years of actual coding experience with a deep understanding of JavaScript/TypeScript and React.
	Startup DNA: Experience working in startups or fast-paced environments. You understand that being &quot;busy&quot; is different from delivering value.
	Backend Familiarity: Experience with backend logic, databases, or tools like Firebase and Supabase.


Why Join Us?


	Salary
	Impact: Your code will help Nigerians avoid real estate fraud.
	Flexibility: Remote work with a focus on value delivery, not hours logged.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume/CV and cover letter to:&nbsp;info@neolivingltd.com&nbsp;and cc:&nbsp;info.neolivingltd@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Software Engineer / Developer Job at NeoLiving Limited




        
    

        
        NeoLiving Limited operates at the intersection of real estate and technology, creating intelligent platforms to revolutionize how properties are discovered and secured. With a focus on fast, transparent, and secure property transactions, NeoLiving eliminates risks such as document fraud. Based in Nigeria, the company leverages local market expertise and advanced technology to cater to the evolving needs of African living. NeoLiving strives to build trust into every property interaction through innovative and reliable systems

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Software Engineer / Developer
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Contract

About the Role
     

            
    




	NeoLiving is PropTech startup that is focused on pure execution.
	We are not looking for a manager to direct others; we are looking for a Builder—someone ready to execute.
	We need someone ready to leverage modern AI tools to ship real features.
	You will not be managing a backlog or writing documents; you will be building the platform that brings trust to the Nigerian property market.


What You Will Actually Do


	Own Your Stack: You will work with React (TypeScript) and modern backend tools. You will not just follow instructions; you will figure out how to make the database secure, the logic sound, and the application performant.
	Refactor & Ship: You will dive into the existing codebase, clean up the rough edges, optimise the logic, and ship it to production.
	Solve Real Problems: You will build features that real people use to buy and rent homes.
	Learn Speed: You will work directly with the Co-founders. You will learn how to ship features in days, not months.


Who You Are


	You have built something before: You have shipped working digital products in the past. You have a portfolio that proves you can finish what you start.
	You are a Troubleshooter: When you hit an error, you do not wait for a manager to chase you around. You search for the solution, you read the documentation, and you fix it.
	You are Autonomous: You do not wait to be told how to do your job. You understand the goal and you find the best way to achieve it.
	You want to grow: You see this role as a stepping stone to becoming a Senior Engineer or a CTO one day.


Requirements


	Solid Experience: 3+ years of actual coding experience with a deep understanding of JavaScript/TypeScript and React.
	Startup DNA: Experience working in startups or fast-paced environments. You understand that being "busy" is different from delivering value.
	Backend Familiarity: Experience with backend logic, databases, or tools like Firebase and Supabase.


Why Join Us?


	Salary
	Impact: Your code will help Nigerians avoid real estate fraud.
	Flexibility: Remote work with a focus on value delivery, not hours logged.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume/CV and cover letter to: info@neolivingltd.com and cc: info.neolivingltd@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

	Guide patients through registration, billing, and service areas, explaining processes clearly and assisting with documentation as needed.
	Log feedback, complaints, and suggestions systematically, escalating complex or unresolved issues to supervisors for timely resolution.
	Support the coordination of appointments and follow-ups, ensuring scheduling is accurate, timely, and communicated effectively to patients.
